intro: Chrysocalyx, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Chrysocalyx is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its medicinal properties.
